description: Variation of conditions 2 (approved plans) of planning permission 00083/F/PA1 approved 07/12/2021 for the change of use from offices to residential to provide 169 dwellings with associated landscaping, car parking, cycle parking and bin storage.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be commenced by 07/12/2024.
Reason: To accord with the provisions of paragraph O.2 (2) Part 3, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in this application and the plans submitted:  
XC114-SBA-H-00-DR- A-04001, XC114-SBA-H-01-DR-A-04002, XC114-SBA-H-02-DR-A-04003,  XC114-SBA-H-03-DR-A-04004, XC114-SBA-H-04-DR-A-04005, XC114-SBA-H-05-DR-A-04006, XC114-SBA-H-06-DR- A-04007, Site location plan HH_LP100, Schedule accommodation XC114-SBA-H-XX-SC-A-0101 (P3), Car Parking Management Plan (Rev 2, dt: April 2024, prepared by Yes Engineering), Healthy Streets Transport Assessment (Rev 1, dt: April 2024, prepared by Yes Engineering), Planning cover letter (24 April 2024) � Received 30/04/2024; XC114-SBA-H-XX-DR-A-00002 (P2) � Received 17/07/2024, HH_P200, HH_P201, Noise Assessment (report no:P21-239-R01v2, dated November 2021, received 16 November 2021).
Reason: To ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission, a satisfactory standard of development is secured and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme
Condition : 3 - All recommended mitigation measures prescribed within the Noise Assessment consented under prior approval 00083/F/PA1 (report no. P21-239-R01v2, dated November 2021) are to be implemented and retained at all times thereafter. 
Reason: In order to ensure that the future residents of the development will not be exposed to a high levels of noise.
Condition : 4 - Prior to occupation, compliance with the criteria set out below shall be demonstrated through internal sound insulation testing and a report submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing.
Maximum noise levels permitted within the dwellings will not exceed those that are specified in Table 4 of British Standard 8233:2014 [Living Rooms = 35 dB LAeq, 16 hours; Dining room/area = 40 dB LAeq, 16 hours; Bedroom = 35 dB LAeq, 16 hours during day-time (07:00 - 23:00) and
Bedroom = 30 dB LAeq, 8 hours during night-time (23:00 - 07:00), night- time (23:00 � 07:00) LAmax noise levels within bedrooms do not exceed 45 dB LAmax more than 10 to 15 times per night.
Reason: In order to ensure that the future residents of the development will not be exposed to a high levels of noise.
Condition : 5 - Prior to occupation, details of the access,lighting,arrangements and management for the storage of residential refuse and recycling including a detailed plan of the residential waste stores, details of how waste collectors will access the waste and the frequency of collection shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.
The works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details before the dwellings are occupied and retained at all times thereafter.
Reason: In the interests of amenity and hygiene; the safe and efficient operation of the local transport network.
Condition : 6 - All parking spaces, including the identified blue badge car parking spaces, active Electric Vehicle Charging Points (EVCP) and passive charging points, shall be laid out in accordance with the approved plans. Prior to occupation full details of the Electric Vehicle Charging Points, each capable of a minimum output of 7.2kW, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include manufacturer's specifications.
The charging points shall be installed in accordance with the approved details and so maintained at all times thereafter.
Reason: In order to promote sustainable modes of transport.
Condition : 7 - Prior to occupation, full details (including access, lighting, manufacturers specifications) of cycle parking facilities including larger bicycles for the occupants of, and visitors to,  the development have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall conform to current guidance such as the TfL London Cycling Design Standards in design and layout and be fully implemented and be made available for use before the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.
Reason: To support sustainable transport objectives.
Condition : 8 - No development (except any demolition, site clearance, ground investigation and remediation work) shall take place until a Car Park Management Plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, containing details of parking for residents of the approved scheme (including spaces for people with disabilities) and detailing the management measures to be used in allocating spaces and controlling their usage. The parking spaces shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details and made available for use before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, and shall be for the sole use of residents of the approved development for parking vehicles without obstruction for the duration of the development.
Reason: In order to ensure that sufficient parking spaces are made available.
